7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:05): 56ba791ed6206b0393e072a90f06db18, when I hook up my HTC dream to my debian box, network-manager can connect. my friend, who has a macbook, could not find any signs of automagic connection setup over USB.
923566ab723c9890cc637d7949124b7d (12:06): would quite possible the only way to get 4.3-like tethering before the clueless operators block it again
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:06): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, T-Mobile is shit everywhere. In Germany, they even want to charge for instant messaging and voip.

7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:07): when i switched to my current carrier, O2, the salesperson actually got me with the ‚Äúwe won't fuck around with your traffic‚Äù part. every other carrier does,
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:07): T-mobile even dynamically re-compresses javascript, breaking the admin interface of an imageboard (that shall not be named) for me.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:08): when i called support to tell them to stop this dickery, the told me i should sent some specific header. i raged, then switched.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:09): there's not a whole lot of choice
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:09): I guess vodaphone would be an alternative...
923566ab723c9890cc637d7949124b7d (12:10): it's the only viable one in the Netherlands
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:11): nope. they block voip AFAIK.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:11): kinda ironic, since they used several high profile bloggers to promote their services, testimonial-style.
923566ab723c9890cc637d7949124b7d (12:12): all these guys should be doing right now is work their asses off to build the best possible mobile network
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:12): ‚Äúthus i stand for this ‚Äî with my tainted name.‚Äù
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:12): if i had a lot of money to burn, I would try competing with them
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:13): 923566ab723c9890cc637d7949124b7d, i suspect that wanting to challenge the status quo is an uncommon disposition.
923566ab723c9890cc637d7949124b7d (12:14): woudn't you much rather just buy a small country if you had that kind of money at your disposal? :)

7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:14): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, the chaos communication congress had its own GSM network. maybe some free mesh network can emerge, like the german ‚Äúfreifunk‚Äù project (when i moved in here, i found empty linksys router packaging in the cupboard).
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:15): at least on the city-level that is feasible. outside, not so.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:15): i would buy a big island with all the additional money i'd make
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:17): 923566ab723c9890cc637d7949124b7d, no. fon is a proprietary piggybacking on that idea, locking down their hardware and creating a walled garden.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:19): 923566ab723c9890cc637d7949124b7d, also: freifunk is actually doing mesh-networking. fon is not.

7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:20): there is a reason for it, unique to germany. after reunification, people dug trenches for optical networks. but after they found out how one can use copper lines for DSL, no one used the fiber.
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (12:20): thus there were (and probably still are) areas where you could not get fast internet. mesh-networking with linux-based routers to the rescue!
